-ioysheSADUWEk;.author: Eva
-ioysheSADUWEk;.title: Will insulin make my patient gain weight?
-ioysheSADUWEk;.content: All my patients with diabete should see an opthalmologist yearly for a dilated eye examination- begining at diagnosis in people with type 2 diabetes, and after 5 years in people with type 1 diabetes after puberty. Patients with known eye disease, symptoms of blurred vision in one eye, or blind spoth may need to see their opthalmologist more frequently.

-pohuvjdasq.author: Joseph
-pohuvjdasq.title: Peripheral neuropathy and muscle spasms question
-pohuvjdasq.content:
Male 38 6"1' White 195 lbs.

He had an incident almost 20 years ago that cut off circulation to the lower half of his body. It caused peripheral neuropathy mostly in his right leg. After years of physical therapy he regained his muscle strength and had almost no problems except a paralyzed right foot starting about 2" above the ankle. This foot gives him some trouble but until recently the rest of his leg has been fine. Now he is having severe muscle cramps in his thigh and butt check. We went to the er last week and they have him an iv with steriods, anti-inflammatory, valium, and a mild pain medicine. This helped for a few days but the pain is coming back. They sent him home with a small script of muscle relaxers but they are gone. Is there anything he can do to ease these cramps?

ASasdASDASDas.author: Patricia
ASasdASDASDas.title: How 'rare' are persistent migraine aura cases?
ASasdASDASDas.content: I have a persistent migraine aura that's been going on for five months, and I don't really have a problem with headaches. I have been doing a lot of research and I have a few questions. I am seeing a neurologist, and both my MRI and EEG came back clear.

poipoiipoyuyti.author: David
poipoiipoyuyti.title: Brain CT scan showed an object, Dr Apt. on Tues, what should I ask the Doctor?
poipoiipoyuyti.content:
I had a head CT scan this week, and the results showed an object likely causing 'mass effect' on the brain. According to the CT scan, it is outside the brain, and appears to be Cerebral Spinal Fluid (CSF). I got an MRI yesterday, and have an appointment with a Neurologist / Neurosurgeon on Tuesday.
What do I need to know to ask / discuss with the Neurologist?
